Work for us

We currently have SIX vacancies:

Full time (36 hours) Deputy Manager

Salary – £22500 – £23500 per annum + 6% pension after 3 months, 6 month probationary period. 

We are looking for the right person/s to join our expanding dementia team based in Romford; you must have working experience and knowledge in this field.  You will be helping the manager organise and run the dementia clubs and companion service.  You are likely to hold an NVQ/QCF Equivalent level 4 in Health & Social Care/Dementia.  You will work with staff and volunteers in creating and providing a tailored programme of activities which meets the assessed needs of clients.

This is an interesting and varied opportunity for the right person, as you will be working with a wide range of people.  If you feel you have these skills and experience we would like to hear from you.

Tapestry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and an independent charity providing a wide range of services for older people across the Borough since 1949.  For further details and information please contact Barbara Low at b.low@tapestry-uk.org or 01708 796610

Closing date:    24th July 2015  

Interviews: TBC

 

Companions  (Dementia Companionship Service)

£7.82 per hour  + 6% pension after 3 months, 6 months probationary period.

Would you enjoy being a companion to someone with dementia? Want to work when it suits you?  You will NEED to have a good working experience and knowledge of dementia and are likely to hold an NVQ/QCF Level 2 in Health and Social Care or be willing to work towards this.

Companions assist and support the Peer Support Clubs Manager in ensuring that a high quality, responsive Companion Service is provided. This will involve the creation and provision of tailored programmes of activities which meets the assessed needs of clients to improve the quality of their life and promotion of independence, mental health and physical well-being and choice.  Car driver with own vehicle is essential.

For more details about the position call Rose Salmon on 01708 797700.  The successful candidate will be subject to an enhanced DBS check. Tapestry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and an independent registered charity (1079969) providing a wide range of services for older people across the Borough and beyond since 1949.

Contact hello@tapestry-uk.org for an application pack or call  01708 796600

 

Care Assistants

Flexible working hours, competitive rates of pay and Pension Scheme. 

Enjoy working with people? Want to work flexibly?  We have fantastic opportunities for experienced Care Assistants in and around Hornchurch, Romford, Harold Hill, Rainham, Barking & Dagenham and Brentwood areas in our Home Care Services.

Key Tasks include general housekeeping e.g. cooking, shopping, domestic duties, etc; providing help with all aspects of personal care; facilitating socialisation and social activities e.g. visiting family/friends, walks, cinema/theatre and monitoring progress and recording notes

You will need at least six months previous experience working as a carer or in the healthcare industry; be passionate about making a difference to an individual’s day to day life and have excellent communication skills.  In return we offer flexible working hours; competitive rates of pay and Pension Scheme; excellent training opportunities and paid travelling time and expenses.

Please send your CV to hello@tapestry-uk.org or for more information call 01708 796600. Only successful candidates will be contacted and invited to the interview.

 

Dementia Advisor

Salary – £21677 per annum (36 hours) + 6% non contributory pension after 3 months, 6 month probationary period. 

We are looking for the right person/s to join our expanding dementia team based in Romford; you must have working experience and knowledge in this field.  The applicant is likely to hold an NVQ/Equivalent level 3 in Information and Advice.  Strong admin, IT and organisational skills are required for this position. You will be expected to maintain an Access Database.

The Dementia Advisor is responsible for ensuring that people with dementia and their carers who access this service are provided with high quality information, advice and support to help them maintain their independence and well-being.

This is an interesting and varied opportunity for the right person, as you will be working with a wide range of people, services and agencies.  If you feel you have these skills and experience we would like to hear from you.  An enhanced DBS check will be required for this role.

Tapestry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and an independent charity providing a wide range of services for older people across the Borough since 1949.

For further details and information please contact Barbara Low at b.low@tapestry-uk.org or 01708 796610

Closing date:    31st July 2015  

Interviews: TBC

Assistant Dementia Advisor

Salary – £18,064 – £20,528 (36hrs per week) + 6% non contributory pension after 3 months, 6 month probationary period. 

The role will need you to manage a caseload of clients under supervision providing ongoing support via telephone or personal contact to people with dementia and their carers/families.

The successful applicant needs to have a good working experience and knowledge of dementia and related issues.  The applicant is likely to hold an NVQ Level 2 in Information & Advice and Health & Social Care or be willing to work towards this.  Strong admin, IT and organisational skills are required for this position and you will be expected to maintain an Access Database.

An enhanced DBS check will be required for this role.

Tapestry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and an independent charity providing a wide range of services for older people across the Borough since 1949.

Contact Barbara Low for an application pack on 01708 796610 or at b.low@tapestry-uk.org

Closing date:    31st July 2015  

Interviews: TBC

 

Trustee/Treasurer 

Voluntary Trustee Position (out-of-pocket expenses reimbursed)

An exciting opportunity to join the board of an innovative social business

 We are looking for someone who is passionate about the improvement of the health and social care of adults, as well as bringing the high level skills and experience needed to provide financial expertise to the board of Trustees and support the strategic direction of the organisation.

The successful candidate will be a qualified accountant with a strong financial background. Experience within the social business or charity sector would be an advantage.

As the Treasurer, you will work closely with our Director of Finance and CEO, overseeing the production of budgets, financial reports, accounts and audits, whilst providing advice and guidance to the Board of Trustees on financial matters.

If you have the skills required, would like the opportunity to be part of an exciting expansion plan and to make a significant difference to people’s lives, please follow the link below for further information of the role, or email your CV to w.lowe@tapestry-uk.org. For the full job description, please read the below PDF:

JD-Treasurer (Opens as a PDF)

Closing date for applications: Midday, Monday 31st August.

Interviews will be held during September.

Tapestry on Facebook

At our group for people with dementia today in Hornchurch there is a fun activity bouncing large balloons on a colourful sheet to music. If you know someone who has dementia and would like to attend any of our local activities do get in touch. View photo →

One of our day centres, HOPWA House, will be holding it’s annual Summer Fete on Wednesday 22nd July 2015 from 10.30 to 2.30. Please come along and get involved, we would love to see you and your family for some summer fun (hopefully in the sun). There will be many stalls and activities including arts and crafts, raffle, bric-a-brac, nearly new, health & beauty, we also have a sweet stall and much more. We will also have some delicious home made cakes if you just fancy stopping by for a cup of tea and a slice of cake relaxing by our pond. Interested in finding out more? Call the centre on 01708 796611 for more information. View photo →
